etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in The Century Dictionary. Probably originally from scientific Latin Monocondylia (HaeckelGen. Morphologie der Organismen II. p. cxxxii; from ancient Greek μονοκόνδυλος having only one joint (from μονο- + κόνδυλος knuckle, joint) + scientific Latin -ia) + -an; compare German Monocondylien (Haeckel 1866, as above)
